intro: Trollius tanguticus var. foliosus, commonly known as the Tangut Globe Flower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its showy, yellow, globe-shaped flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and broad, lobed leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. Its foliage is often a distinguishing feature, with deeply divided leaves that contribute to its ornamental value. This species thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a suitable candidate for rock gardens and alpine settings.
